title: Tamarind Shrimp
ingredients: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
2 tablespoons tamarind pulp dissolved in ¼ cup hot water
instructions: Rinse and clean the shrimp in cold running water then drain them well.

In a bowl, combine the tamarind pulp and water with the soy sauce, 1 teaspoon of the ginger, half the garlic, and the mirin, sesame oil, and the chili paste.  Add the shrimp, toss, and let them stand in the marinade for 10 minutes.
Remove the shrimp from the marinade and drain them well and reserve the marinade.

In a carbon-steel wok, heat the oil over high heat, add the remaining ginger and garlic, and stir-fry for 30 seconds.  Add the shrimp and stir-fry until they turn pink and are just done.  Add the reserved marinade and cook everything for another 30 seconds to 1one full minute, tossing constantly.  Stir in the cilantro, remove from the heat, and serve.
Remarks:  The tart flavor of tamarind goes well with the sweetness of the shrimp, which is intensified by the Mirin in the dish.
Source:  New Wok Cooking by Rosa Ross, Clarkson Potter/Publishers, New York, © 2000 by Rosa Ross.
